newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada spot natural gas prices turn lower on week.
newsitem.headline: Canada spot natural gas prices turn lower on week.

text.p: Most Canadian spot natural gas prices for September eased from week-ago levels in Wednesday trade with marketers expecting prices to remain in recent ranges.

Gas for September delivery at the AECO storage hub in Alberta was talked in the C$1.12/1.125 per gigajoule range, down from C$1.14/1.145 last week. One-year gas at Empress, Alberta out of November also dropped about two cents to C$1.36 per GJ.
One Calgary trader said storage injections at all three Alberta facilities were at about 880 million cubic feet a day.

He said cooler temperatures in western Canada will likely keep prices in the C$1.12/1.16 range over the coming week as gas is stored at the low end of the range and withdrawn at the upper end. "The cool weather will take some of the slop off the system," the trader said.
At the borders, gas at Huntington, British Columbia was discussed in the US$0.99/1.02 range, about the same as last week. Kingsgate also saw little change despite cooler weather.

A Vancouver-based marketer said that although prices would likely not increase much beyond current levels, Sumas pricing was exceeding expectations of earlier this year. -- Reuters Calgary Bureau 403 531-1624
